job_tasks.justification: This phrase directly relates to understanding what the users or business require, which is a core aspect of business understanding.

job_tasks.phrase: Detailing the functional requirements and user stories into various deliverables.
job_tasks.justification: Translating business needs (user stories) into technical specifications is a key component of business understanding and aligning technical solutions with business goals.

job_tasks.phrase: Evaluating designs with key users, stakeholders and end users.
job_tasks.justification: This involves getting feedback from business representatives to ensure the technical solution meets their needs, fitting the business understanding category.

job_tasks.phrase: With the PO, key users, stakeholders and end users about functional requirements and user stories
job_tasks.justification: This describes communication with business stakeholders about requirements, which falls under understanding the business context.
The term 'Modelling' directly implies creating or designing a model, specifically for CI/CD deployment in this context.
This is a direct statement about creating models and designs, which aligns with the 'Modeling' task category.

job_tasks.phrase: Writing and managing Puppet roles and Ansible playbooks
job_tasks.justification: Puppet and Ansible are tools used for configuration management and automation, which are part of the software development lifecycle and infrastructure as code.

job_tasks.phrase: Taking more junior Linux engineers on board and training them.
job_tasks.justification: Mentoring and training junior engineers is a form of knowledge transfer and team development, often associated with engineering roles.

job_tasks.phrase: Contributing to the functional testing of delivered software.
job_tasks.justification: Participating in testing is an integral part of the software development lifecycle to ensure quality and functionality.

job_tasks.phrase: (Detail) designs (depending on the assignment ranging from wireframe to interactive prototype)
job_tasks.justification: Creating prototypes and detailed designs, especially interactive ones, is a software development activity.
Explicitly mentions being part of a DevOps team, indicating involvement in operations and development practices.
AWX is a platform for Ansible, used for automation, which falls under operations and MLOps/DevOps practices.

job_tasks.phrase: Automation and implementation of RHEL, RedHat, IPA, Ansible, Puppet, VMWare, NSX-T LVM, PKI, NFS
job_tasks.justification: This involves the automation and implementation of various system administration and infrastructure tools and services, which are core to operations engineering.

soft_skills.phrase: communicate frequently and frequently with: - With the PO, key users, stakeholders and end users about functional requirements and user stories - With the Teamlead about the functional content, usability and progress of the work package and about test results.
Taking more junior Linux engineers on board and training them.
build and professionalise our Linux environment.

classification.rationale: The job description focuses on traditional Linux system administration, DevOps practices, and infrastructure management using tools like Ansible and Puppet. There is no mention of AI, machine learning, large language models, or generative models, which are the core focus of the GenAI Engineer profile.
